column1: This file will be used to upload data to the NelsonDB. FIELD NAMES CAN BE ADDED, BUT SHOULD BE DONE SPARINGLY

column2: For recording information about glycerol stocks.

column7: Definition
The experiment name to which this glycerol stock is a part of.
A unique identifier for the glycerol stock, such as 102G. MUST BE UNIQUE
The location of where the glycerol stock is located. Leave blank if not applicable.
The date when the glycerol stock was stocked. Recommended format : 2015-01-30 14:50. Leave blank if not applicable.
The visible color of the extract. Leave blank if not applicable.
The organism that the extract was from. Example: Fungus, Bacterial. Leave blank if not applicable.
Any additional comments. Leave blank if not applicable.
The Field Name from which the glycerol stock was collected. Example Aurora NY. Leave blank if not relevant.
The Culture ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if not applicable.
The DNA ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if not applicable.
The Plant ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Example 08PN0023_001. Leave blank if glycerol stock not collected from a plant.
The Row ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Example 09PN0023. Leave blank if not applicable.
The Plate ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if not applicable.
The Tissue ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if glycerol stock not collected from a tissue.
The Seed ID from which the glycerol stock is associated. Leave blank if not applicable.
The Sample ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if not applicable.
The Microbe ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if not applicable.
The Well ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if not applicable.
The IsolateStock ID from which the glycerol stock was collected. Leave blank if not applicable.

column2: For recording the glycerol stock's location

column7: Definition
The city, state, country, zipcode where the location is.
A descriptive name for the location. MUST BE UNIQUE
The building name. Example: Plant Science, Emerson
The room number or name
The shelf in which the glycerol stock is located. Example: 1, 2, 3
The column in which the glycerol stock is located. Example: A, B, C
The box which the glycerol stock is in.
Any additional comments about the location of the glycerol stock.

column2: For recording information about a locality.

column7: Definition
The locality's city name.
The locality's state.
The locality's country.
The locality's zipcode.
